item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Can Elevate One of PLA's Best Concepts to New Heights
item.description:
As the successor to Pokemon Legends: Arceus , it's expected that Pokemon Legends: Z-A will share some of the same features and mechanics as its predecessor. Although Pokemon Legends: Z-A differentiates itself from Legends: Arceus with its modern setting within Lumiose City and emphasis on trainer battles in the Z-A Royale, the core action-based RPG elements of its predecessor remain intact. There is likely still a lot left to be revealed about Pokemon Legends: Z-A in the lead-up to its launch, and one of Legends: Arceus ' best mechanics remains a major question mark.

Pokemon Legends: Arceus took the series' iconic battles to a new level by introducing larger-than-life bosses in the form of Alpha Pokemon and Frenzied Noble Pokemon. These powerful variants created an atmosphere of danger to the world that previous Pokemon games never really had. As such, rampaging Alpha Pokemon may not fit Lumiose City's urban environment, but the return of Mega Evolution could offer an ideal alternative that could be tailored to fit within Legends: Z-A's world .

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Has the Perfect Answer for Legends: Arceus' Alphas

Wild Mega Evolutions Could Replace Alpha Pokemon in Legends: Z-A

Mega Evolution is being placed front and center in Pokemon Legends: Z-A as the spotlight feature of the game after being absent from the franchise for two generations. With such a heavy emphasis being placed on these supped-up critters, it seems more than likely that Megas will play a large role in the gameplay loop of Pokemon Legends: Z-A . While battles against trainers who use Mega-Evolved Pokemon seem like a given for Legends: Z-A , the game could take things a step further and feature boss battles against wild Mega-Evolved mons as well.

Alpha Pokemon, while much stronger and more intimidating than their usual counterparts, change very little visually aside from their size and glowing red eyes. Conversely, seeing a Mega-Evolved creature among a group of non-Megas would feel far more intimidating while exploring the Wild Zones throughout Lumiose City. Legends: Arceus ' Alpha Pokemon already felt like a different take on the Mega Evolution concept, so replacing them wholly with Megas in Legends: Z-A seems like a logical step. However, Legends: Z-A may need to get creative with how it retcons established lore in order for this mechanic to work.

There is still the potential for Alpha Pokemon to return in Legends: Z-A , as the official map of Lumiose City appears to feature an icon that is very similar to the one for Alpha Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Arceus .

It May Be a Stretch, But Wild Mega Evolutions Are Too Cool a Concept to Pass Up

The major catch with the concept of wild Mega Evolutions is the fact that, typically, Mega Evolution can only occur under the guidance of a trainer who holds a mon's specific keystone. With Mega Evolution being an artificial way to enhance a Pokemon's power, it might seem odd if players could find Mega-Evolved mons out in the wild. However, there are still ways that Pokemon Legends: Z-A could implement this mechanic while still keeping it lore-friendly.

For example, the sundial in Anistar City is already known to have a strong connection to Mega Evolution and the keystones that allow the phenomenon to happen. Perhaps this sundial is connected to the remnants of the ultimate weapon that caused Mega Evolution to be possible in the first place, with more of its potential remains being found beneath Lumiose City. This could be used as a major plot point in the story of Pokemon Legends: Z-A , while also helping to explain why random wild critters are suddenly gaining the ability to Mega Evolve without the use of a keystone.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: How to Get Daedric Armor Early
item.description:
No matter how advanced The Hero of Kvatch's skills are, without good weapons and armor, you will have a hard time surviving in battle. Luckily, there's plenty of good gear to be found in the vastness of Cyrodiil, sometimes in rather unobvious places. So, in this guide, we'll tell you how to get Daedric armor early in Oblivion Remastered .

Daedric armor is one of the high-quality pieces of equipment you can find. As befits heavy armor, it has high defense values ​​and also looks very strong. But getting it can be difficult if you don't know which specific inn to visit.

How to Get Daedric Armor Early

Most items, loot, and enemy strength are tied to your character's level. So the stronger you become, the more dangerous enemies and drops will be on your way. For this reason, players do not have the opportunity to get rare armor sets at the very beginning. In the case of Daedric armor, you need to reach at least level 19 and preferably 20 for the armor to start spawning in Oblivion Remastered .

It would be more correct to say that once you reach this level, you will start meeting NPCs wearing high-quality armor. So you just need to find these unlucky characters and kill them to get Daedric armor. Alternatively, you can try to steal it, but you will need a high Sneak skill for this.

Where to Find Daedric Armor and Glass Armor

If you want to get a new Daedric or Glass set as soon as you reach the required level, then you should visit the Roxey Inn north of the Imperial City in Oblivion Remastered . There you will find Rigmor and her two companions. She wears the desired Daedric armor, while the other two wear Glass armor.

We recommend that you talk to the other guests in the building and make them like you. That way, when you attack Rigmor, the other guests will help you.

After that, all you have to do is loot the body to collect a full set of Daedric armor, except the helmet in Oblivion Remastered . Unfortunately, Rigmor wears the Helmet of Spell Resistance, although it is quite good. You will also want to check the pockets of her companions. Although they are wearing Glass armor, they can use the Daedric Longsword in combat. So take all of this for personal use or sell if you already have a more preferred weapon.

item.title: Schedule 1 Shares First Look at New Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Schedule 1 shares new images of upcoming content update.
  • The update is "almost ready" to enter the open beta branch in Steam.
  • Three images show the addition of a new property and a jukebox.

Schedule 1 developer TVGS has given fans a sneak peek at the game's next major content update, which will soon be available via the open beta branch on Steam. Schedule 1 was only released in early access in March, but it has already received a handful of significant updates, featuring gameplay improvements, bug fixes, and new content.

After becoming a massive hit on Steam last month, Schedule 1 's solo developer has revealed a plethora of planned content updates. As the game is still in early access, TVGS has numerous plans for the game's future. Last week, during a developer live stream, Tyler, the game's creator and solo developer, gave fans a rough idea of what an upcoming map expansion for Schedule 1 would look like. While it's still likely to be some time before it makes its way into the game, Tyler intends to add a whole new area and expand on existing land with new houses and customers for players to unlock.

Schedule 1 Shares Images From New Update

In a new post on Twitter, Tyler has given fans a first look at the next Schedule 1 update, which the developer says is "almost ready" to release in the open beta branch on Steam. The images, which can be seen below, show a brand-new building known as "Stash & Dash." It's unclear if this will be a new business for players to launder money or a property for players to purchase, but some have speculated that the large building will act as a storage center for products. The images also tease the addition of a jukebox, which will likely allow players to change the game's soundtrack.

The release date for the update is unknown, but it will be entering the Schedule 1 beta branch before it receives a full release. This will allow players to provide Tyler with any feedback surrounding issues with the update, which will then hopefully be fixed by the time the update receives a full release. For those eager to check out the content as soon as possible, the beta branch can be accessed by heading to Schedule 1 on Steam, right-clicking the game, and navigating to Properties, then selecting Betas and changing the Beta Participation to Beta.

Tyler also recently announced the addition of a highly requested feature for Schedule 1 . In a new update to the game's official Trello board, Tyler confirmed that lockers will soon replace employee beds. Currently, whenever a player hires an employee, they must ensure that a bed is placed at the property so that their wage can be placed inside of their briefcase. However, many fans believe the beds take up far too much room and suggested that lockers replace them. Again, it's unclear when this feature will make its way into Schedule 1 , but fans can expect it in a future update.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: How to Solve Wisdom of the Ages Puzzle
item.description:
Oblivion Remastered 's dungeons contain both fierce enemies and various puzzles. The latter can be particularly tricky, such as those in Fort Bulwark. So in this guide, we'll tell you how to solve Wisdom of the Ages puzzles in Oblivion Remastered .

Wisdom of the Ages is a side quest that players can begin after meeting Sir Henrik during the Priory of the Nine quest. The reward for completing it is the Shield of the Crusader and more common loot. But to do so, you'll have to complete several puzzles.

Wisdom of the Ages Puzzle Solution

The goal of the Wisdom of the Ages quest is to find the Shield of the Crusader in Fort Bulwark. Once you receive the quest, the desired point will be marked on your map. However, finding the Fort is the easiest task. Inside, you will find traps, Conjurers, and 3 puzzles. You can get to the Shield of the Crusader only by solving them all. Here are the solutions for each of the Wisdom of the Ages quests in Oblivion Remastered .

Tiles Puzzle

The first puzzle in Fort Bulwark is a small corridor with 12 tiles in a row of 3. At the end of the corridor, you will find a closed grate which opens by pressing on the correct tiles. It is worth noting that you must press one tile in each row:

  • The Leftmost tile of the first row
  • The Middle tile of the second row
  • The Rightmost tile of the third row
  • The leftmost tile of the fourth row

Just step on them in the correct order, and you will be able to explore Fort Bulwark further.

Statues Puzzle

Moving further along the intricate corridors, you will come to a room with 4 statues facing different directions in Oblivion Remastered . Also, on the floor between them, you can notice a stone sign. The solution to this Wisdom of the Ages puzzle is to rotate all the statues so that their faces look at the sign on the floor. To do this, players can use the crank at the base of each statue.

Rodger’s Chest puzzle

The last puzzle separating you from the Shield of the Crusader is the most difficult and confusing. You will find a room with a Rodger's chest in the center and 8 regular ones near the walls. In addition, next to the golden chest, there is a pressure plate that shows a projection of the item on one of the chests.

For this puzzle, players must take an item from Rodger's chest and then place it in the correct chest by the wall, then repeat this 7 more times. However, the item immediately disappears, so you can not then move it between regular chests. Also, the pressure plate shows another projection only after you put the item in the chest, whether correctly or not.

In other words, the puzzle implies that you put items in random chests several times and, along the way, remember their correct placement in Oblivion Remastered . But to make your life easier, you can use the hint below.

The items are placed in clockwise order, starting from the right side, assuming you are facing Rodger's chest:

  • Rodgar's Stone
  • Rodgar's Helm
  • Rodgar's Goblet
  • Rodgar's Sword
  • Rodgar's Book
  • Rodgar's Hammer
  • Rodgar's Skull
  • Rodgar's Gem

When you place an item in the appropriate chest, the statue behind it rotates. And after you place all the items, the door to the Shield of the Crusader will open.
